SEARCH
Package pt.ipp.isep.dei.esoft.project.domain.graph

Interface Graph<V,E>

Type Parameters:
V - Vertex value type
E - Edge value type
All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable
All Known Implementing Classes:
CommonGraph, MatrixGraph
public interface Graph<V,E> extends Cloneable
The interface Graph.

  • Method Details

    • isDirected

      boolean isDirected()
      Check if graph is directed
      Returns:
      true if graph is directed, false otherwise

    • numVertices

      int numVertices()
      The total number of vertices in the graph
      Returns:
      the number of vertices of the graph

    • vertices

      ArrayList<V> vertices()
      All the vertices in the graph
      Returns:
      all the vertices of the graph as an ArrayList. Each vertex is in its key position in the ArrayList.

    • validVertex

      boolean validVertex(V vert)
      Check is vertex is in graph
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex to check
      Returns:
      true is vert exists in the graph, false otherwise

    • key

      int key(V vert)
      Check the numeric key for vert in the graph
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex to check
      Returns:
      the numeric key associated with vert, -1 if vert is not in the graph

    • vertex

      V vertex(int key)
      Check the vertex associated with a numeric key in the graph
      Parameters:
      key - the key to check
      Returns:
      the vertex associated with key, null if key is not in the graph

    • vertex

      V vertex(Predicate<V> p)
      Find the first vertex for which Predicate is true. An example to get the Person vertex with a particular name: 
            Graphinvalid input: '<'Person, Integer> g = new ...;
      g.vertex( p -> p.getName().equals(name) );
      Parameters:
      p - predicate (should be given in lambda form)
      Returns:
      the first vertex for which predicate p is true, null if not found

    • adjVertices

      Collection<V> adjVertices(V vert)
      Find all adjacent vertices of a vertex
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex for which to find adjacent vertices
      Returns:
      a collection of all the adjacent vertices of vert

    • numEdges

      int numEdges()
      The total number of edges of the graph
      Returns:
      the number of edges of the graph

    • edges

      Collection<Edge<V,E>> edges()
      All the edges of the graph
      Returns:
      a collection with all the edges of the graph.

    • edge

      Edge<V,E> edge(V vOrig, V vDest)
      Finds an edge in the graph given its end vertices
      Parameters:
      vOrig - origin vertex
      vDest - destination vertex
      Returns:
      the edge from vOrig to vDest, or null if vertices are not adjacent

    • edge

      Edge<V,E> edge(int vOrigKey, int vDestKey)
      Finds an edge in the graph given its end vertex keys
      Parameters:
      vOrigKey - the key of vertex vOrig
      vDestKey - the key of vertex vDist
      Returns:
      the edge from vOrig to vDest, or null if vertices are not adjacent

    • outDegree

      int outDegree(V vert)
      Finds the number of edges leaving a vertex
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex of interest
      Returns:
      the number of edges leaving vert

    • inDegree

      int inDegree(V vert)
      Finds the number of edges for which a vertex is the destination
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex of interest
      Returns:
      the number of edges for which vert is the destination

    • outgoingEdges

      Collection<Edge<V,E>> outgoingEdges(V vert)
      Finds the edges for which a vertex is the origin
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex of interest
      Returns:
      a collection of edges for which vert is the origin

    • incomingEdges

      Collection<Edge<V,E>> incomingEdges(V vert)
      Finds the edges for which a vertex is the destination
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex of interest
      Returns:
      a collection of edges for which vert is the destination

    • addVertex

      boolean addVertex(V vert)
      Adds a new vertex into the graph
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex to add
      Returns:
      true if vert is not already in the graph, false otherwise

    • addEdge

      boolean addEdge(V vOrig, V vDest, E weight)
      Adds a new edge between two vertices. If the vertices are not already in the graph, they are added.
      Parameters:
      vOrig - origin vertex
      vDest - destination vertex
      weight - the weight of the edge
      Returns:
      false if edge is already present, true otherwise

    • removeVertex

      boolean removeVertex(V vert)
      Removes a vertex and all its incident edges from the graph
      Parameters:
      vert - the vertex to remove
      Returns:
      true if vert was present in the graph, false otherwise

    • removeEdge

      boolean removeEdge(V vOrig, V vDest)
      Removes the edge between two vertices
      Parameters:
      vOrig - vertex origin of the edge
      vDest - vertex destination of the edge
      Returns:
      true if an edge between vOrig and vDest was present in the graph, false otherwise

    • clone

      Graph<V,E> clone()
      Creates a deep copy clone of the graph
      Returns:
      a deep copy of graph
